thread.title: Komets 4-0 after overtime win over Indy
thread.title_full: Komets 4-0 after overtime win over Indy

title: Komets 4-0 after overtime win over Indy
text:
Komets 4-0 after overtime win over Indy 
By Dean Pantazi - 21 Alive October 24, 2015 Updated Oct 24, 2015 at 11:31 PM EDT 
FORT WAYNE, Ind. (21 Alive) - Alex Belzile scored with just 22 seconds left in overtime to give the Komets a 6-5 win over the Indianapolis Fuel Saturday night and a 4-0 start to the new season. 
Peter Sivak had forced the extra session with a goal with 56 seconds left in regulation. 
Trevor Cheek and Jordon Southorn each scored twice to complete the Fort Wayne offense for the night. 
Pat Nagle turned back 22 of 27 shots for the win in goal. 
Rhett Bly had two goals for the Fuel, one of them on the first penalty shot called in the ECHL this season/
